PhysicsVector

      Methods in <Unnamed> that return PhysicsVector 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static PhysicsVector PhysicsVector.add​(PhysicsVector v, PhysicsVector u)
      standard vector addition.
      PhysicsVector GravBody.calcGrav​(GravBody q)
      Returns the gravitational attraction of one body onto this body, using g = (Gm/r^2)r^ where g is the acceleration due to gravity, G is the Gravitational Constant, m is the mass of the other body, r is the displacement vector between the bodies, and r^ is the unit vector of this displacement vector
      PhysicsVector GravBody.getAngularMomentum​()
      Returns the angular momentum of the body
      PhysicsVector GravBody.getg​()
      Returns the surface gravity of the body
      PhysicsVector GravField.getg​()
      Gets the vector form of the acceleration due to gravity at a point
      PhysicsVector GravBody.getPosition​()
      Returns the position of the body
      PhysicsVector GravBody.getTotAcc​()
      Returns the total acceleration of the body
      PhysicsVector PhysicsVector.getUnitVector​()
      Returns a vector with magnitude of one and the origibal direction of the original vector.
      PhysicsVector GravBody.getVelocity​()
      Returns the velocity of the body

      void GravBody.setBody​(PhysicsVector p, PhysicsVector u)
      Sets the body's position and velocity using PhysicsVectors
      void GravField.setGrav​(PhysicsVector r)
      Calculates the acceleration due to gravity at a point r from the surface of a body using g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
      void GravBody.setPosition​(PhysicsVector p)
      Sets the body's position using a PhysicsVector

      void GravBody.verletPtTwo​(PhysicsVector intialTotA, double t)
      Implements the last part of the Verlet algorithm to move a body foward by a time step.
      Constructors in <Unnamed> with parameters of type PhysicsVector 
      Constructor Description
      GravBody​(java.lang.String a, PhysicsVector p, PhysicsVector u, double M, double d)
      Constructor of GravBody that sets the position and velocity using PhysicsVectors.
      GravField​(double M, double R, PhysicsVector r)
      Constructs a GravField of a body with mass M and radius R and a g at a distance from the surface of r, using: g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
      GravField​(PhysicsVector r, double m)
      Constructs a GravField of a point object with mass m, with g calculated at a distance r, using g = (GM/r^2)r^ Where r^ is the unit vector of r which is the displacement from the centre of the body to the point where g is to be calculated
      PhysicsVector​(PhysicsVector v)
      Constructor that creates a vector with the same value as the PhysicsVector passed as an argument.
